column.name: prefix
column.remarks: used for creating public identifiers for samples

column.name: num_unambiguous_sites
column.remarks: Number of sites with allele A, C, T, or G

column.name: num_missing_alleles
column.remarks: Number of sites with N, the missing allele, typically indicating low depth

column.name: num_mixed
column.remarks: Number of sites with an ambiguous allele, e.g. M, K, Y, etc., indicating support for 2 or more alleles in the reads.

column.name: private_identifier
column.remarks: This is the private identifier groups (DPHs) will use to map data back to their internal databases.

column.name: original_submission
column.remarks: This is the original metadata submitted by the user.

column.name: public_identifier
column.remarks: This is the public identifier we assign to this sample.

column.name: region
column.remarks: This is the continent this sample was collected from.

column.name: czb_failed_genome_recovery
column.remarks: This is set to true iff this is sample sequenced by CZB and failed genome recovery.

column.name: start_datetime
column.remarks: datetime when the workflow is started.

column.name: end_datetime
column.remarks: datetime when the workflow is ended. this is only valid when the workflow's status is COMPLETED.

column.name: software_versions
column.remarks: A mapping between all the tools used in this workflow and the version used.
